page.title: 17Home Life-Washing cont.
page.content: are not efficient at removing the plaque which is regarded as the cause of decay. Only a few of the sample admitted to their family having a special "bath night" when they or anybody else regularly bathed. Baths are taken when people felt like it. Children claim to bathe at least once a week. Few claim that they like to take a shower at School, even after a games lesson when they return to lessons sticky. Sponges are used by some to create lather in the bath; others stick to their flannels. The old loofah has disappeared from homes in Rainhill. Families are increasingly installing showers into their homes because they are told that because they use less water then a shower will cost the family less to run. There is an interesting contrast
